tags.description:
Operations related to managing Ocpp Tag groups.
The Ocpp Tag Group is a logical grouping of Ocpp Tags.
This allows for flexible management of permissions in bulk (see permission-controller).
tags.name: ocpp-tag-group-controller

tags.description:
Web users can interact with the system both through the web-based graphical user interface and via REST API access.
REST API endpoints allow authorized users to perform actions such as viewing transactions, managing OCPP tags, and more, protected by Basic Authentication mechanism.
The email-password pair should be used to construct the Basic Authentication HTTP header for the REST API calls.
tags.name: web-user-controller

tags.description:
Operations that can be initiated by the Central System at the Charge Points.
Some of these operations allows multiple Charge Points to be selected, whereas others are specific to a single Charge Point.
For the detailed information on the parameters, please refer to the OCPP specification.
tags.name: ocpp-operations-controller

tags.description:
Operations related to managing permissions of Ocpp Tags.
A permission is granting of access of an Ocpp Tag to a Charge Box.
This allows the owner of the Ocpp Tag, e.g., to start and stop charging sessions at that Charge Box.
In order to manage permissions in bulk, we also support managing permissions for "tag groups".
Permission management uses the tree model created by the site management.
This means: instead of assigning permissions directly to particular Charge Boxes, we create the association with the site node.
Since charge boxes can be associated with nodes, the permission of an Ocpp Tag to a Charge Box happens transitively.
tags.name: permission-controller

tags.description: Operations related to managing Charge Points.
tags.name: charge-point-controller

tags.description:
Operations related to managing the topology of a site.
A site is a physical location where charge boxes are installed.
The site is modeled as a tree structure with nodes representing different parts of the site.
Each node can have children nodes, which allows for a flexible representation of the site.
Charge boxes can be associated with nodes in the tree.
tags.name: site-controller

tags.description:
Operations related to querying transactions.
A transaction represents a charging session at a charge box (i.e. charging station. The notions 'charge box' and 'charging station' are being used interchangeably).
tags.name: transaction-controller

tags.description: Provides endpoints to retrieve and update application settings, including OCPP and Mail configurations.
tags.name: setting-controller

tags.description:
Operations related to managing Ocpp Tags.
An Ocpp Tag is the identifier of the actor that interacts with the charge box.
It can be used for authorization, but also to start and stop charging sessions.
An RFID card is an example of an Ocpp Tag.
tags.name: ocpp-tag-controller

tags.description:
Operations related to managing users (i.e. end-users).
The user is a customer, client; a person who is using the services of charging stations via this platform.
A user is the holder of an Ocpp Tag.
tags.name: user-controller

get.description: Returns a list of Charge Points based on the query parameters. The query parameters can be used to filter the Charge Points. The response payload contains only an overview each Charge Point. Please refer to GET /api/v1/chargePoints/{chargeBoxPk} for the details of a Charge Point.

Deletes an existing Charge Point based on the chargeBoxPk.
Returns the deleted Charge Point.
This is a very destructive operation:
Deleting a charge point causes losing all related information including transactions, reservations, connector status and connector meter values.

Returns a list of reservations based on the query parameters.
The query parameters can be used to filter the reservations.

parameters.description:
If 'ACTIVE' is selected, all reservations that have not expired yet are returned.
In this case, the 'from' and 'to' fields will be ignored.
If 'FROM_TO' is selected, the 'from' and 'to' fields are required.
In this case, all reservations that have started after 'from' and did not expire before 'to' are returned.
parameters.name: periodType

schema.description:
If 'ACTIVE' is selected, all reservations that have not expired yet are returned.
In this case, the 'from' and 'to' fields will be ignored.
If 'FROM_TO' is selected, the 'from' and 'to' fields are required.
In this case, all reservations that have started after 'from' and did not expire before 'to' are returned.

parameters.description: Show results that happened after this date/time. Format: ISO 8601 with timezone. Example: `2024-08-25T14:30:00.000Z`
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Show results that happened before this date/time. Format: ISO 8601 with timezone. Example: `2024-08-25T14:30:00.000Z`

get.description: Returns all sites. Depending on the number and complexity of the sites, this is potentially an expensive call. Please refer to GET /api/v1/sites/{id} for the details of how a site object looks like.

parameters.description:
Flag to control whether the returned data should contain the address information and the
complete site structure tree or not. If the latter, only the site id and name will be returned.
parameters.name: withDetails

schema.description:
Flag to control whether the returned data should contain the address information and the
complete site structure tree or not. If the latter, only the site id and name will be returned.

post.description:
Creates a new site with the given structure.
The request payload should contain general information about the site and a flexible tree structure at 'structure' that models the real-world arrangement of this site.
It can contain multiple, hierarchical levels and nodes within the tree (see 'children').
Charge boxes can be associated with each node.

delete.description:
Deletes the site with the given id.
It will also delete all nodes, charge boxes and permissions associated with the site.
This is a very destructive operation.

get.description:
Returns the site with the given id.
The returned payload contains general information about the site and a flexible tree structure at 'structure' that models the real-world arrangement of this site.
It can contain multiple, hierarchical levels and nodes within the tree (see 'children').
Charge boxes can be associated with each node.

patch.description: Updates an existing site with the provided parameters.

put.description: Associates charge boxes with their PKs at the specified nodePk. The charge boxes and the site tree structure have to exist beforehand. Deprecated because /api/v1/sites/{id}/node/{nodeId}/chargePoints/add replaces this endpoint!

delete.description: Deletes the node with nodeId in site with id. This will effectively delete the subtree beginning with nodeId from the site structure. All charge boxes and permissions associated with the nodes within that subtree will also be deleted.

patch.description: Changes the name of the node with nodeId in site with id.

put.description: Adds a new node from the request payload to the site with id as a direct child under the parent node with nodeId. This new node can have its own children and charge boxes associated with it (and hence, can be seen as a subtree). The call returns the updated site structure.

get.description: Returns the charge boxes associated with the specified nodeId.

parameters.description: If true, traverses the tree recursively and returns charge boxes at all descendant nodes, as well.
parameters.name: includeAllChildren

put.description: Associates charge boxes with their PKs at the specified nodeId. The charge boxes and the site tree structure have to exist beforehand.

parameters.description: If true, all existing associations of these charge box PKs will be removed first. Effectively, these new associations will replace the existing ones.
parameters.name: removeExistingAssociations

put.description: Removes charge boxes with their PKs from the specified nodeId. The charge boxes and the site tree structure have to exist beforehand.

Moves the node with nodeId in site with id as a direct child under the parent node with newParentNodeId. Moving a node will also move all its children to the new parent. Therefore, this operation can be seen as a 'subtree move'. All charge boxes and permissions associated with the node will remain associated with it after the move. However, the permission inheritance will be different: the node will now inherit permissions from the new parent node instead of the old one (see appliesToAllChildren of permission APIs). The call returns the updated site structure.

get.description:
Returns a list of charging profiles based on the query parameters.
The query parameters can be used to filter the results.

post.description:
Creates a new charging profile with the provided parameters.
The request body should contain the necessary information.

get.description: Returns an overview of smart charging profiles assigned to charging stations, filtered by query parameters.

delete.description: Deletes an existing charging profile based on the chargingProfilePk. Returns the deleted charging profile.

get.description: Returns a single charging profile based on the chargingProfilePk.

put.description: Updates an existing charging profile with the provided parameters.

Controls and changes the flow rate of an ongoing/active transaction. minRateAmpere and maxRateAmpere define the boundaries of the flow rate. The optional validFrom and validTo can be used to set the time window in which the new flow rates should be applied. Various combinations of these parameters can be used to achieve many use cases.

parameters.description: Can be omitted in most cases, since the minimum flow is rarely an issue.
parameters.name: minRateAmpere

schema.description: Can be omitted in most cases, since the minimum flow is rarely an issue.

parameters.description: Can be set to 0 to effectively stop the electricity flow.
parameters.name: maxRateAmpere

schema.description: Can be set to 0 to effectively stop the electricity flow.

parameters.description:
Defines the time from which the new flow rates should be applied.
If not set, the new flow rates will be applied immediately.
parameters.name: validFrom

schema.description:
Defines the time from which the new flow rates should be applied.
If not set, the new flow rates will be applied immediately.

parameters.description:
Defines the time until which the new flow rates should be applied.
If not set, the new flow rates will be applied until the end of the transaction.
parameters.name: validTo

schema.description:
Defines the time until which the new flow rates should be applied.
If not set, the new flow rates will be applied until the end of the transaction.

get.description:
Returns charging consumption data as CSV between the given 'from' and 'to' timestamps.
All transactions that stopped between the given timestamps are included.
The exported data can be used for reports or can be imported into 3rd party payment/billing systems.
As default, we return a standard CSV format/template.
We support custom CSV templates, though.
If you need a custom CSV template, please contact the Powerfill team with the specifications.

Returns the details of a single transaction based on the transactionPk.
The details are the intermediate values of the transaction.

patch.description: Manually changes this transaction from 'active' to 'stopped'.

parameters.description: Should be exact match.
parameters.name: userPk

Can be exact or substring match: any name containing the given string will be returned.
Moreover, the name input can be a combination of first and last name.

chargeBoxPks.description: Charge box PKs to be added to site at node with id 'nodePk'

nodePk.description: Identifies the node of the site at which to add charge boxes

appliesToAllChildren.description: Should this permission apply only to this particular node (then set to false), or to all its children in site tree as well (then set to true)

nodePk.description: Identifies the node of the site at which to add permission for the respective Ocpp Tags

ocppTagPks.description: PKs of Ocpp Tags to configure permissions for

appliesToAllChildren.description: Should this permission apply only to this particular node (then set to false), or to all its children in site tree as well (then set to true)

nodePk.description: Identifies the node of the site at which to add permission for the respective Ocpp Tag groups

ocppTagGroupPks.description: PKs of Ocpp Tag groups to configure permissions for

appliesToAllChildren.description: Should this permission apply only to this particular node (then set to false), or to all its children in site tree as well (then set to true)

nodePk.description: Identifies the node of the site at which to add permission for the respective Ocpp Tags

userPks.description: User IDs/PKs to configure Ocpp Tag permissions for

chargeBoxId.description: This field is set when adding a charge point, and cannot be changed later.

endpointAddress.description: The endpoint at which the Charge Point is reachable. Only relevant/set for Charge Points using SOAP

insertConnectorStatusAfterTransactionMsg.description:
After a transaction start/stop message, a charging station might send a connector status notification, but it is not required.
If this is enabled, SteVe will update the connector status no matter what.

lastHeartbeatTimestamp.description: When did last heartbeat from the Charge Point arrive?

ocppProtocol.description: The OCPP protocol of the Charge Point

siteAndNodeInfo.description: Will be null, if this Charge Point is not associated with a site and node.

chargeBoxId.description: This field is set when adding a charge point, and cannot be changed later.

insertConnectorStatusAfterTransactionMsg.description:
After a transaction start/stop message, a charging station might send a connector status notification, but it is not required.
If this is enabled, SteVe will update the connector status no matter what.

chargeBoxId.description: The unique OCPP identifier of the Charge Point

chargeBoxPk.description: Database primary key of the Charge Point

description.description: The description of the Charge Point

ocppProtocol.description: The OCPP protocol of the Charge Point

jsonAndDisconnected.description: This is true, if the chargeBox this connector belongs to is a WS/JSON station and it is disconnected at the moment of retrieving the status.

commaSeparatedCustomConfKeys.description: Comma separated sequence of Custom Configuration Keys

confKeyList.description:
List of Configuration Keys predefined by Ocpp.
The documented keys are the superset of all keys defined in Ocpp versions 1.2, 1.5 and 1.6.
Therefore, not all possible keys apply to all Ocpp versions.

location.description: The URL where charge point should upload the log file

retries.description: Number of times charge point should retry upload if it fails

retryInterval.description: Interval in seconds between retry attempts

start.description: Oldest timestamp to include in log file

stop.description: Latest timestamp to include in log file

chargeBoxPks.description: The charge box PKs associated with the node

children.description: The direct children of the node (if any) represented as a list of nodes

nodeId.description: The unique identifier of the node

appliesToAllChildren.description: Does this permission apply only to this particular node (then set to false), or to all its children as well (then set to true)

nodePk.description: PK of the node at which the permission is set

expiration.description:
The amount of time in hours for how long a charge point should cache the authorization info of an idTag in its local white list, if an expiry date is not explicitly set.
The value 0 disables this functionality (i.e. no expiry date will be set).

heartbeat.description:
The time interval in minutes for how often a charge point should request the current time from backend.
The value 0 requests clients to use reasonable default values.

idTag.description:
This field is set when adding an OCPP Tag, and cannot be changed later.
    Will be used in create/insert flows. Will be ignored in update flows.

maxActiveTransactionCount.description:
Set to 0 to block this tag.
Set to a negative value to disable concurrent transaction checks (i.e. every transaction will be allowed).
Set to a positive value to control the number of active transactions that is allowed.

internalName.description: Internal name of Ocpp Tag group

ocppTagIds.description: Ocpp Tags associated with this group

activeTransactionCount.description: The number of currently active transactions for this OCPP tag

expiryDate.description: The date/time at which the OCPP tag will expire (if set)

inTransaction.description: Has the OCPP tag active transactions (i.e. ongoing charging sessions)?

maxActiveTransactionCount.description: The maximum number of active transactions allowed for this OCPP tag

parentIdTag.description: The parent OCPP tag of this OCPP tag

parentOcppTagPk.description: PK of the parent OCPP tag of this OCPP tag

userPk.description: PK of the user this OCPP tag belongs to (if any)

nodePk.description: PK of the node with the associated permissions

tagGroupPermissions.description: Ocpp Tag group permissions for the node

tagPermissions.description: Ocpp Tag permissions for the node

ocppTagPk.description: PK of Ocpp Tag with the associated permissions

permissions.description: List of permissions for the Ocpp Tag

ocppTagGroupPk.description: PK of Ocpp Tag group with the associated permissions

permissions.description: List of permissions for the Ocpp Tag group

ocppTags.description: List of permissions for the Ocpp Tags associated with the user

chargingProfilePk.description: PK of the charging profile to be used for the transaction. ChargingProfilePurposeType of the profile must be TX_PROFILE.

transactionId.description: Apply the profile to the transaction with this ID. ChargingProfilePurposeType of the profile must be TX_PROFILE.

internalName.description: The internal name of the site

siteId.description: The unique identifier of the site

structure.description: The tree structure of the site

appliesToAllChildren.description: Does this permission apply only to this particular node (then set to false), or to all its children as well (then set to true)
Does this permission apply only to this particular node (then set to false), or to all its children as well (then set to true)

Transaction.description:
For active transactions, all 'stop'-prefixed fields would be null.
The energy consumed during the transaction can be calculated by subtracting the 'startValue' from the 'stopValue'.
The unit of the 'startValue' and 'stopValue' is watt-hours (Wh).

chargeBoxId.description: The identifier of the charge box at which the transaction took place

chargeBoxPk.description: PK of the charge box at which the transaction took place

connectorId.description: Connector ID of the charge box at which the transaction took place

ocppIdTag.description: The Ocpp Tag used in the transaction

ocppTagPk.description: PK of the OCPP tag used in the transaction

startTimestamp.description: The timestamp at which the transaction started

startValue.description: The meter value reading at the start of the transaction

stopEventActor.description: The actor who stopped the transaction

stopReason.description: The reason for the transaction being stopped

stopTimestamp.description: The timestamp at which the transaction ended

stopValue.description: The meter value reading at the end of the transaction

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns the Ocpp Tag associated with this transaction

ocppTagPks.description: Ocpp Tag PKs of this user that have no permissions at all.

location.description: URL where charge point can download the firmware

retrieveDateTime.description: When charge point should start downloading firmware

retryInterval.description: Interval in seconds between retry attempts
